[[Criminal Procedure in Indonesia]] |abovestyle=border-bottom:1px solid #CC0000;" colspan="1" |headerstyle = color:white;background:brown; |labelstyle = color:black;background:white; |datastyle = color:black;background:white;align:center; |header1 = Criminal Procedure Code |data2 = Kitab Undang-Undang Hukum Acara Pidana (KUHAP)
Number 8 of 1981 |header3 = Relevant Provisions |data4 = '''Chapter V''' - Arrest, Detention, Search of the Person, House Entry, Seizure and Examination of Documents
'''Chapter VI''' - The Suspect and The Accused
'''Chapter XVI''' - Examination at Trial
'''Chapter XVII''' - Ordinary Legal Remedies
'''Chapter XVIII''' - Extraordinary Legal Remedies
'''Chapter XIV''' - Investigation
'''Chapter XIX''' - The Execution of Judgements |header5 = Courts of Indonesia |data6 = General Courts of Justice
Religious Courts
Military Courts
Administrative Courts
Human Rights Courts |header7 = Number of Cases Received in 1997 by State |data8 = }} {{Main article|Criminal procedure|Criminal law}} [[Indonesia]] is a [[Civil law (legal system)|civil law]] country with five major codes. Its [[criminal procedure]] code, the [http://defensewiki.ibj.org/images/6/62/Indonesia_Law_of_Criminal_Procedure.pdf Kitab Undang-Undang Hukum Acara Pidana ("KUHAP")], determines the procedures and rights of individuals at different stages of the [[trial]] process. == Brief History of Indonesia's Criminal Procedure == === Colonial Times === Before 1910, “Hukum Adat” or Adat laws applied in Indonesia. When the Dutch colonized Indonesia in 1910, they set up a [[civil law system]] that took precedence over the Adat laws. In terms of the criminal procedure, for example, the Dutch enacted two [[statute]]s to govern different parts of Indonesia. The ''Herziene Inlandsch/Indonesisch Reglement'' ("HIR")http://www.ladvolaw.com/indonesian-overview.html (accessed 15 September 2011) applied to Jawa and Madura, while the ''Rechtsreglement Buitengewesten'' ("Rbg") applied to the rest of Indonesia. The Adat laws applied to the [[natives]] only if it did not clash with the Dutch statutory provisions.''IDE Asian Law Series No. 8'', Achmad Ali, Law and Development in Changing Indonesia === Japanese Occupation === When the Japanese occupied Indonesia in March 1942, they applied their Japanese [[Martial Law]]. This superseded all existing laws in Indonesia at that time. === Present === Today, Indonesia’s legal system is based on Dutch Colonial Law, Adat Law and National Law.{{harvp|Strang|2008|p=195}}http://www.lu.se/images/Syd_och_sydostasienstudier/working_papers/mason.pdf at p4 (accessed 14 September 2011) After Indonesia gained [[independence]] in August 1945, it adopted the Dutch HIR as its code of criminal procedure. In 1981, Indonesia replaced HIR with the KUHAP. The KUHAP improved upon the HIR by adding [[adversarial system|adversarial]] features to the criminal procedure. However, the KUHAP does not sufficiently protect [[human rights]] and its safeguards are often ignored in practice because there are no penalties for failing to comply with the Act. In response to dissatisfaction with the formal procedures in the Act, a working group drafted a new statue to replace the KUHAP in 2000. However, Indonesia has not adopted the working group's recommendations to date. == Steps involved in an ordinary criminal trial == [[File:Criminal Process in Indonesia (2).jpg|thumb|Criminal Trial Process in Indonesia|400px|left]] === Arrest === The police must produce a [[arrest warrant|warrant]] upon arrest if the suspect is not "caught in the act".{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 18(1)}} They must also send a copy of such warrant to the suspect’s family.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 18(3)}} === Detention === Suspects must be released within one day of arrest{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 19(1)}} unless the investigator, prosecutor, or judge orders a [[Remand (detention)|detention]]. Detention is limited to offences liable to imprisonment of 5 years or more, and crimes under Art 21(4)(b).{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 21(4)}} Suspects may be detained for a maximum of 60 days without [[judiciary|judicial]] consent. === Investigation === Investigators must inform the public prosecutor before they begin their investigations.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 109(1)}} If the investigation is terminated due to insufficient evidence or if the event does not constitute an [[offence (law)|offence]], investigators must inform the prosecutor and suspect.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 109(2)}} During investigation, investigators have the authority to summon [[witness]]es for examination. When the investigation is completed, investigators must promptly submit the dossier of the case to the public prosecutor. If the public prosecutor believes that the investigation is incomplete, he will return the dossier and order for a supplementary investigation.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 110}} The dossier is then resubmitted. === Prosecution === After examining the dossier of the case, the public prosecutor will determine if the case meets the requirements to be brought to court. If he decides to prosecute, he must prepare a Bill of [[Indictment]] and bring the action before an appropriate district court.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 140(1)}} Summonses will then be issued to the suspect and witnesses, if any, to attend trial. If the public prosecutor decides to cease prosecution, he must produce a written decision to be sent to suspect, investigator, and the judge.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 140(2)}} Please refer to the [[Indonesian Criminal Procedure#Appendix|appendix]] for more information about the structure of Indonesia's Public Prosecution Service. === Pre-trial proceedings === Pre-trial proceedings are limited to examining whether the arrest and/or detention was legal and to decide whether the district court has the jurisdiction to try the case. === Trial procedures === At the outset of trial, the prosecutor will read out the Bill of Indictment. The judge will then summon the accused and witnesses to give their [[testimony|testimonies]], which will then be examined. The head judge will lead the examination at trial. The prosecutor and the legal counsel may question the witnesses through the head judge.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 164(2)}} If an accused refuses to answer a question, the head judge will suggest that he answer and thereafter continue the examination.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 175}} After examination, the prosecutor will submit his charges before the accused submits his defence. The prosecutor may reply to the defences put up, provided that the accused has a right to reply.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 182(1)(b)}} The head judge will then consult other judges on the bench before he reaches a decision. === Judgment === The court will acquit the accused if guilt has not been legally and convincingly proven or dismiss all charges if the acts do not constitute an offence.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 191(1) and 191(2)}} If the court concludes that the accused is guilty of committing the offence, it will impose a punishment.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 193(1)}} The public prosecutor will then execute the [[judgment]].{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 13}} == The appeal process == === Ordinary legal remedies === [[File:Appeals procedure.jpg|thumb|The Appeal Process|400px]] Once a decision has been reached and read by the judge in a General Court of first instance, the aggrieved party may file an [[appeal]] to the relevant court of appeal within seven days.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 233(2)}} No appeal can be filed against a:{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 67}} # Judgment of [[acquittal]] that relates to an inappropriate application of law; or # Judgment of dismissal of all charges that relates to an inappropriate application of law; or # Judgment under express procedure.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 204 & 205}} A judgment is made under express procedure when only one judge adjudicates the case because it is clear and minor. There are three grounds for appealing to the High Court:{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 240}} # Where a [[procedural law|law of procedure]] has been negligently applied; # Where a mistake is found in the examination at first instance; # Where something is incomplete in the examination at first instance. After the High Court passes a judgment on an appeal, the aggrieved party can appeal to the Supreme Court as a matter of cassation.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 244}} There are three grounds for appealing to the Supreme Court:{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 253}} # Where a legal rule has not been applied or has been applied in an improper manner; # Where the method of adjudication was not concluded according to the provisions of law; # Where the court has exceeded the limits of its competence. === Extraordinary legal remedies === Judgments are final and binding at the last appellate level. However a convicted person or his family may seek a final extraordinary remedy by submitting a request to the Supreme Court for reconsideration of the judgment, except when it is a judgment of acquittal or the dismissal of charges.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 263}} Such a request is not time-barred{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 264(3)}} and may only be made once.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 268(3)}} A request for reconsideration of a judgment may be made when:{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 262}} # New circumstances give rise to a strong presumption that had such circumstances been known during the trial, there would have been an acquittal or dismissal of all charges, or the charges of the public prosecutor would not have been acceptable, or that a less severe criminal provisions would have applied to the case. # Matters or circumstances that form the basis and reasoning of the judgment are declared contradictory. # A judgment clearly displays a mistake made by the judge or a manifest error. # An alleged act which has been declared proven in the judgment, but has not been followed up by the imposition of a penalty. == Role of the judge == [[File:IndonesianSupremeCourt.jpg|Indonesia Supreme Court|thumb|left|240px]] The role of judges in the Indonesian criminal justice system is to impose a proper punishment on offenders based on a sufficient means of legal proof. Judges are generally only involved in the trial proceedings. When a judge receives a Bill of Indictment from the Public Prosecutor, he will determine a trial date and order the latter to summon the accused and witnesses to attend the trial.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 152}} During the trial proceedings, the judge is obliged to ensure that the defendant or witness remains free to answer the questions posed. If the judge fails to do so, his decision will be annulled.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 153}} At the end of the trial proceedings, the judge can only convict a person if he has at least two pieces of legal evidence supporting the conviction.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 183}} Based on the evidence presented, the judge can punish, acquit or dismiss the charges against the accused. If the accused is convicted and he is sentenced to a punishment that deprives him of his [[liberty]], the judge will assist the head judge to supervise the execution of the punishment.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 280}} == Role of the prosecutors == The Public Prosecution Service of Indonesia is the only agency that has state powers to prosecute offenders. As such, there is no private prosecution in the Indonesian criminal justice system. Prosecutors are involved in the whole trial process, from the investigations, to trial proceedings and the execution of punishment. At the investigation stage, the prosecutor supervises the police’s investigations. The prosecutor only personally investigates cases when there are special crimes, such as [[corruption]].{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 284}} Once the police complete investigations, they hand the [[evidence]] to the prosecutor. If the evidence is satisfactory,{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 139}} the prosecutor will prosecute the offender at an appropriate court.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 143}} He will prepare a Bill of Indictment for the judge{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 140}} to begin the trial proceedings. During the trial proceedings, the prosecutor must ensure that the defendant, witnesses and experts are all present. The prosecutor must also present all evidence concerning the crime."http://www.unafei.or.jp/english/pdf/RS_No53/No53_22PA_Zaimaru.pdf" (accessed 15 September 2011) In practice, the prosecutor usually presents three or more pieces of legal evidence to support the defendant’s guilt. After the judge has passed judgment on the case, the judge’s clerk will send a copy of the execution of punishment to the prosecutor. The prosecutor will then execute the punishment.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 270}} == Legal protections for the accused == === Rights to counsel === A suspect has a right to obtain legal assistance from one or more legal [[counsel]]s at every stage of the examination.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 52}} At the start of the investigations, the police will inform the suspect of his right to receive legal assistance during examination at trial.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 114}} If the suspect does not have legal assistance, he will receive free [[legal aid]] if he faces the [[Capital punishment in Indonesia|death penalty]], or imprisonment of fifteen years or more. The suspect will also receive free legal aid if he is destitute and faces imprisonment of five year or more.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 56(1)}} Once the suspect obtains legal assistance, the counsel has a right to contact him from the moment he is arrested or detained. The counsel also has a right to be present at, and listen to, [[interrogation]]s. This ensures that the police do not carry out unfair interrogation techniques. === Rules of evidence === The court only admits five types of legal evidence. They are:{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 184}} # The testimony of a witness # The testimony of an expert # A document # An indication # The testimony of the accused In terms of the witness' testimony as a means of legal proof, the judge will compare a witness’ testimony against other witness testimonies or other means of proof to determine whether the testimony is true. In the process, he also considers all other factors that affect the witness’ credibility.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 185(6)}} A witness usually makes a testimony under [[oath]]. However, a testimony not made under oath can still be admitted as supplemental legal evidence if it is consistent with a testimony made under oath.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 185(5)}} As for an indication as a means of legal proof, an indication is an act, event, or situation that is consistent with other facts.{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 188(1)}} It can only be obtained from the testimony of a witness or accused, or from a document. To convict an accused, a judge must have at least two means of legal proof to support the charge. This ensures that a suspect cannot be convicted merely because he confessed his guilt. == Current controversies and debates == === Problems concerning evidence === Indonesian courts only acc have a clear provision on the admissibility of illegally obtained evidence. Hence, the prosecution can present evidence that was obtained through torture, ill-treatment, or contrary to any provision in the KUHAP. Furthermore, there is no judicial avenue for an accused to seek redress if illegal evidence were presented at trial. This undermines the legal safeguards in the KUHAP.{{harvp|Strang|2008|p=189}} === Restricted rights to counsel === Counsel has a right to contact his client “at every moment.” However, this right is undermined because a 1983 Ministry of Justice regulation interprets the phrase to mean that the client has a right to communicate with his counsel ‘at every moment during office hours’. Based on this, police stations mysteriously close when lawyers visit their clients. This prevents the counsel from communicating with his client, undermining the suspect’s right to counsel.{{harvp|Lindsey|2008|p=148}} === Abuse of detention powers === The police can abuse its powers to detain a suspect by using threats of detention to pressure a suspect to confess that he is guilty. In addition, the KUHAP does not ensure that detainees are brought to court promptly. Under the KUHAP, a suspect can be detained for up to 60 days without judicial intervention. For example, if the police detains a suspect for 20 days under Art24(1), a prosecutor can extend this detention for another 40 days under Art 24(2).{{harvp|Lindsey|2008|p=190}} Please refer to the [[Indonesian Criminal Procedure#Appendix|appendix]] for more information about how long a suspect can be detained without judicial intervention. === Fictional right to silence === Finally, it is unclear whether an accused has a right to remain silent during examination. Although an accused “shall not be burdened with the duty of giving evidence”,{{harvp|KUHAP|1981|loc=Art 66}} Art 175 seems to undermine this right. Under Art 175, the head judge can suggest that the accused answers the question. The examination will continue after the head judge makes this suggestion. However, since there is a high respect for authority in Indonesia, the head judge's “suggestion” will probably persuade the accused to answer the question. This undermines the right to remain silent during examination.{{harvp|Lindsey|2008|p=192}} == See also == *[[Law of Indonesia]] *[[Constitution of Indonesia]] *[[Outline of Indonesia]] *[[Civil law (legal system)]] == References == {{reflist|21em}} ===Bibliography=== {{refbegin}} *{{cite book |editor-last=Lindsey |editor-first=Tim |year=2008 |title=Indonesia, Law and Society |publisher=Federation Press |edition=2nd |isbn=9781862876606 |ref=harv}} *{{cite journal |last=Strang |first=Robert |year=2008 |title="More Adversarial, but not Completely Adversarial": Reformasi of the Indonesian Criminal Procedure Code |journal=[[Fordham International Law Journal]] |volume=32 |issue=1 |pages=188–231 |url=http://ir.lawnet.fordham.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=2191&context=ilj |ref=harv}} *{{cite book |trans-title=Indonesian Criminal Procedure Code |title=Kitab Undang-Undang Hukum Acara Pidana |year=1981 |url=http://defensewiki.ibj.org/images/6/62/Indonesia_Law_of_Criminal_Procedure.pdf |ref=CITEREFKUHAP1981}} {{refend}} == External links == *[http://en.hukumonline.com/ Legal Updates in Indonesia] *[http://www.mahkamahagung.go.id/ Supreme Court of the Republic of Indonesia] *[http://defensewiki.ibj.org/images/b/b0/Indonesia_Penal_Code.pdf Indonesia Penal Code] *[http://www.unafei.or.jp/english/pdf/RS_No76/No76_14RC_Group3.pdf A comparison of the Trial and Sentencing Process] *[http://www.mongabay.com/history/indonesia/indonesia-criminal_law.html Indonesia Criminal Law] *[http://www.aseanlawassociation.org/papers/JudicialSystem.pdf The Judicial System in Indonesia] *[http://ir.lawnet.fordham.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=2191&context=ilj&sei-redir=1#search=%22criminal%20procedure%20indonesia%22 Proposed Reforms of the Indonesia Criminal Procedure Code] *[http://www.unhcr.org/refworld/country,,AMNESTY,COUNTRYREP,IDN,4562d8cf2,4517a1fa4,0.html Comments on the Draft Revised Criminal Procedure Code] [[Category:Crime in Indonesia]]

{{Infobox MP |honorific-prefix = |name = Jam Kamal Khan |office = 16th [[Chief Minister of Balochistan]] |term_start = 19 August 2018 |term_end = |governor = [[Muhammad Khan Achakzai]]
[[Amanullah Khan Yasinzai]] |predecessor = [[Alauddin Marri]] (caretaker) |office1 = Member of the [[Provincial Assembly of Balochistan]] |term_start1 = 13 August 2018 |term_end1 = |constituency1 = PB-50 (Lasbela-II) |office2 = [[Ministry of Energy (Pakistan)|Minister of State for Petroleum]] |term_start2 = 4 August 2017 | term_end2 = 2 April 2018 |primeminister2 = [[Shahid Khaqan Abbasi]] |president2 = [[Mamnoon Hussain]] |office3 = [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Resources (Pakistan)|Minister of State for Petroleum & Natural Resources]] |term_start3 = 7 June 2013 | term_end3 = 28 July 2017 |president3 = [[Mamnoon Hussain]] |primeminister3 = [[Mian Muhammad Nawaz Sharif]] | office4 =Member of the [[National Assembly of Pakistan]] | term_start4 = 1 June 2013 | term_end4 = 31 May 2018 | constituency4 = [[Constituency NA-270|NA-270 (Awaran-cum-Lasbela)]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age| 1973 |1|1}} |nationality = Pakistani |party = [[Balochistan Awami Party]] |father = [[Jam Mohammad Yousaf]] |relations = ''[[Jam of Lasbela]]'' }} '''Jam Mir Kamal Khan Alyani''' ({{Lang-ur|{{Nastaliq|جام كمال خان}}}}; born 1 January 1973) is a Pakistani politician who is the current and 16th [[Chief Minister of Balochistan]], in office since 19 August 2018. He has been a member of the [[Provincial Assembly of Balochistan]] since August 2018. Previously he a member of the [[National Assembly of Pakistan]] from June 2013 to May 2018 and served as Minister of State for [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Resources (Pakistan)|Petroleum and Natural Resources]] in the cabinet of Prime Minister [[Nawaz Sharif]] from 2013 to 2017 and again from August 2017 to March 2018 in the cabinet of Prime Minister [[Shahid Khaqan Abbasi]]. ==Personal life and education== He was born on 1 January 1973 to [[Jam Mohammad Yousaf]].{{cite web|title=Detail Information|url=http://www.pildat.org/mna/rsDetail.asp?detid=270|accessdate=11 July 2017|date=19 April 2014|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140419140253/http://www.pildat.org/mna/rsDetail.asp?detid=270|archivedate=19 April 2014|df=}} He holds a degree in marketing from [[Greenwich University, Karachi]].{{cite web |title=Jam Kamal Khan |url=https://www.weforum.org/people/jam-kamal-khan |publisher=World Economic Forum |accessdate=18 August 2018}} He is the current and 13th [[Jam of Lasbela]]. He belongs to the royal [[Jam family of Lasbela]].{{cite web | url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/503288/37th-jam-of-lasbela-mir-kamals-coronation-held/ | title=37th Jam of Lasbela Coronation | publisher=The Express Tribune | date=16 Feb 2013 | accessdate=4 July 2014 | deadurl=no | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714225815/http://tribune.com.pk/story/503288/37th-jam-of-lasbela-mir-kamals-coronation-held/ | archivedate=14 July 2014 | df= }} ==Political career== He twice served the District Nazim of the [[Lasbela District]]{{cite web | url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/TodaysPrintDetail.aspx?ID=81030&Cat=4&dt=12/24/2007 | title=Nazim Lasbela District | publisher=The News | date=16 Nov 2007 | accessdate=4 July 2014 | deadurl=no | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714135109/http://www.thenews.com.pk/TodaysPrintDetail.aspx?ID=81030&Cat=4&dt=12%2F24%2F2007 | archivedate=14 July 2014 | df= }} before he was elected to the [[National Assembly of Pakistan]] as an independent candidate from [[Constituency NA-270|Constituency NA-270 (Awaran-cum-Lasbela)]] in [[Pakistani general election, 2013]]. He received 56,658 votes and defeated Ghulam Akbar Lasi, a candidate of [[Pakistan Peoples Party]] (PPP). In the same election, he ran for the seat of the [[Provincial Assembly of Balochistan]] from [[Constituency PB-45 (Lasbela-II)]] as an independent candidate but was unsuccessful. He received 20,169 votes and lost the seat to [[Mohammad Saleh Bhutani]].{{cite web|title=2013 election result|url=https://ecp.gov.pk/Documents/General%20Elections%202013%20report/Election%20Report%202013%20Volume-II.pdf|publisher=ECP|accessdate=3 April 2018|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201140612/https://ecp.gov.pk/Documents/General%20Elections%202013%20report/Election%20Report%202013%20Volume-II.pdf|archivedate=1 February 2018|df=}} In June 2013, he was appointed as the Minister of State for [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Resources (Pakistan)|Petroleum & Natural Resources]] in the [[Cabinet of Pakistan|Cabinet]] of [[Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif]].{{cite web | url=http://www.nation.com.pk/national/07-Jun-2013/25-member-federal-cabinet-sworn-in | title=Sworn in as Minter of State | publisher=The Nation | date=7 June 2013 | accessdate=4 July 2014 | deadurl=no | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140210145811/http://www.nation.com.pk/national/07-Jun-2013/25-member-federal-cabinet-sworn-in | archivedate=10 February 2014 | df= }} He had ceased to hold ministerial office in July 2017 when the federal cabinet was disbanded following the resignation of Prime Minister [[Nawaz Sharif]] after [[Panama Papers case (Pakistan)|Panama Papers case]] decision.{{cite news|title=PM Nawaz Sharif steps down; federal cabinet stands dissolved|url=https://en.dailypakistan.com.pk/pakistan/pm-nawaz-gives-up-his-post-federal-cabinet-stands-dissolved/|accessdate=28 July 2017|work=Daily Pakistan Global|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170728114411/https://en.dailypakistan.com.pk/pakistan/pm-nawaz-gives-up-his-post-federal-cabinet-stands-dissolved/|archivedate=28 July 2017|df=}} Following the election of Shahid Khaqan Abbasi as Prime Minister of Pakistan in August 2017, he was inducted into the federal cabinet of [[Abbasi ministry|Abbasi]].{{cite news|title=A 43-member new cabinet sworn in|url=https://www.app.com.pk/a-43-member-new-cabinet-sworn-in/|accessdate=4 August 2017|work=Associated Press Of Pakistan|date=4 August 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170804174456/https://www.app.com.pk/a-43-member-new-cabinet-sworn-in/|archivedate=4 August 2017|df=}}{{cite news|title=PM Khaqan Abbasi’s 43-member cabinet takes oath today|url=https://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2017/08/04/new-federal-cabinet-ministers-take-oath-today/|accessdate=4 August 2017|publisher=Pakistan Today|date=4 August 2017}} He was appointed as the [[Ministry of Energy (Pakistan)|Minister of State for Petroleum]], a division under then newly created Ministry of Energy.{{cite news|title=Portfolios of Federal Ministers, Ministers of State announced|url=http://www.radio.gov.pk/05-Aug-2017/portfolios-of-federal-ministers-ministers-of-state-announced|accessdate=5 August 2017|work=Radio Pakistan|date=5 August 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170805181242/http://www.radio.gov.pk/05-Aug-2017/portfolios-of-federal-ministers-ministers-of-state-announced|archivedate=5 August 2017|df=}}{{cite news|title=Portfolios of federal, state ministers|url=https://www.thenews.com.pk/print/221526-Portfolios-of-federal-state-ministers|accessdate=5 August 2017|work=www.thenews.com.pk|language=en|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170805133715/https://www.thenews.com.pk/print/221526-Portfolios-of-federal-state-ministers|archivedate=5 August 2017|df=}} In April 2018, he resigned from the post of Minister of State for Petroleum.{{cite news|title=President accepts Petroleum Minister Jam Kamal Khan’s resignation|url=https://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2018/04/03/president-accepts-petroleum-minister-jam-kamal-khans-resignation/|accessdate=3 April 2018|work=Pakistan Today|date=3 April 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180403062148/https://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2018/04/03/president-accepts-petroleum-minister-jam-kamal-khans-resignation/|archivedate=3 April 2018|df=}} In April 2018, he quit PML-N{{cite news |last1=Hussain |first1=Javed |title=Magsi, Kamal, Domki quit PML-N, set to join newly-formed BAP |url=https://www.dawn.com/news/1399768 |accessdate=19 August 2018 |work=DAWN.COM |date=5 April 2018}} and helped in creating [[Balochistan Awami Party]] (BAP).{{cite news |last1=Shah |first1=Syed Ali |title=Jam Kamal Khan sworn in as Balochistan's 16th chief minister |url=https://www.dawn.com/news/1428003/jam-kamal-khan-sworn-in-as-balochistans-16th-chief-minister |accessdate=19 August 2018 |work=DAWN.COM |date=19 August 2018}} In May 2018, he was elected first president of the BAP.{{cite news|title=Jam Mir Kamal gets elected BAP chief, urges unity for Balochistan’s rights|url=https://www.dawn.com/news/1408175/jam-mir-kamal-gets-elected-bap-chief-urges-unity-for-balochistans-rights|accessdate=17 May 2018|work=DAWN.COM|date=17 May 2018}} ==Chief Minister== He was elected to the Provincial Assembly of Balochistan as a candidate of BAP from Constituency PB-50 (Lasbela-II) in [[Pakistani general election, 2018]].{{cite news |title=BAP’s Jam Kamal Khan wins PB-50 election |url=https://www.app.com.pk/baps-jam-kamal-khan-wins-pb-50-election/ |accessdate=18 August 2018 |work=Associated Press Of Pakistan |date=26 July 2018}} Following his successful election, BAP nominated him for the office of [[Chief Minister of Balochistan]].{{cite news |last1=Shah |first1=Syed Ali |title=BAP nominates Jam Kamal for Balochistan chief minister slot |url=https://www.dawn.com/news/1424253 |accessdate=18 August 2018 |work=DAWN.COM |date=1 August 2018}} On 18 August 2018, he was elected Chief Minister of Balochistan. He received 39 votes against his opponent [[Mir Younus Aziz Zehri]] who received 20 votes.{{cite news |last1=Shah |first1=Syed Ali |title=Balochistan Assembly: Jam Kamal voted in as 16th chief minister |url=https://www.dawn.com/news/1427776/balochistan-assembly-jam-kamal-voted-in-as-16th-chief-minister |accessdate=18 August 2018 |work=DAWN.COM |date=18 August 2018}}{{cite news |title=BAP's Jam Kamal elected Balochistan chief minister {{!}} The Express Tribune |url=https://tribune.com.pk/story/1783765/1-jam-kamal-khan-elected-balochistan-chief-minister/ |accessdate=18 August 2018 |work=The Express Tribune |date=18 August 2018}} The same day, he was sworn in as the 16th chief minister of Balochistan. After assuming the office as the Chief Minister, Khan formed a 10-member cabinet. Of the 10-member cabinet sworn in on 27 August 2018, 9 were provincial ministers and 1 was advisor.{{cite news |title=Nine ministers, one adviser sworn into Balochistan cabinet {{!}} The Express Tribune |url=https://tribune.com.pk/story/1789208/1-nine-ministers-one-adviser-sworn-balochistan-cabinet/ |accessdate=14 September 2018 |work=The Express Tribune |date=28 August 2018}} The second part of his cabinet, consisting of 2 provincial ministers was sworn in on 8 September 2018 increasing the size of the cabinet to 12.{{cite news |title=Balochistan cabinet swells to 12 as two new ministers take oath |url=https://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2018/09/08/balochistan-cabinet-swells-to-12-as-two-new-ministers-take-oath/ |accessdate=14 September 2018 |work=www.pakistantoday.com.pk |date=8 September 2018}} The same day, he appointed three advisors.{{cite news |title=Three MPAs appointed as Balochistan CM’s advisers {{!}} The Express Tribune |url=https://tribune.com.pk/story/1798085/1-three-mpas-appointed-cms-advisers/ |accessdate=14 September 2018 |work=The Express Tribune |date=8 September 2018}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{Chief Minister of Balochistan}} {{Sharif III Cabinet}} {{Abbasi Cabinet}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Khan, Jam Kamal}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Baloch people]] [[Category:Pakistani MNAs 2013–18]] [[Category:Balochistan MPAs 2018–23]] [[Category:Pakistan Muslim League (N) MNAs]] [[Category:People from Lasbela District]] [[Category:Balochistan Awami Party MPAs (Balochistan)]] [[Category:Jams of Lasbela]] [[Category:Chief Ministers of Balochistan, Pakistan]]

revision.text:
[[Image:Lauburu.svg|thumbnail|right|A typical lauburu. Each arm can be drawn with three sweeps of a compass]] {{multiple image | footer = Left and right facing lauburu | width = 100 | image1 = Coa_Illustration_Cross_Lauburu.svg | alt1 = | image2 = Coa_Illustration_Cross_Lauburu_2.svg | alt2 = }} [[File:Lauburu harria.jpg|thumb|A lauburu carved into a stone.]] The '''lauburu''' or '''Basque cross''' ({{lang-eu|lauburu}}, "four heads") is a traditional Basque hooked cross with four [[comma (punctuation)|comma]]-shaped heads. Today, it is a symbol of the [[Basque Country (greater region)|Basque Country]] and the unity of the [[Basque people]]. It is also associated with Celtic peoples, most notably [[Galicians]] and [[Asturians]]. It can be constructed with a compass and straightedge, beginning with the formation of a square template; each head can be drawn from a neighboring vertex of this template with two compass settings, with one radius half the length of the other.
==Background== [[Image:Marquise of Santa Cruz by Goya.jpg|thumb|The [[lyre]] of ''[[Joaquina Téllez-Girón, Marchioness of Santa Cruz]]'' by [[Francisco de Goya]] (around 1805) is decorated with a lauburu.]] [[File:Taufstein Labach.JPG|thumb|right|180px|A lauburu on the [[baptismal font]] at the church of [[Knopp-Labach]]]] [[File:Logotipo de Acción Nacionalista Vasca.svg|thumb|180px|[[EAE-ANV]] logo]]
Historians and authorities have attempted to apply [[allegory|allegorical]] meaning to the ancient symbol. Some say it signifies [[laurak Bat|the "four heads or regions"]] of the [[Basque Country (historical territory)|Basque Country]].<!-- Broken link [http://www.bcbasque.com/HTMLfiles/lauburu.htm BCbasque.com] --> The lauburu does not appear in any of the seven coats-of-arms that have been combined in the arms of the Basque Country: Higher and Lower [[Navarre]], [[Gipuzkoa]], [[Biscay]], [[Álava]], [[Labourd]], and [[Soule]]<!-- Broken link [http://gofree.indigo.ie/~janoty/euskadi/zazpiak.htm Indigo.ie] -->. The [[Basque people|Basque]] intellectual Imanol Muxika liked to say that the heads signify spirit, life, consciousness, and form<!-- Broken link [http://www.bcbasque.com/HTMLfiles/lauburu.htm BCbasque.com] -->, but it is generally used as a [[symbol]] of prosperity.
After the time of the [[Antonines]], [[Camille Jullian]]<ref name="Camille">M. Camille Jullian in his preface to ''La tombe basque'', according to [http://www.euskomedia.org/aunamendi/87432?idi=en&clave=87432&op=4&primR=21&regs=10&EIKVOGEN=lauburu&pos=29&epi=64714#mrc1 Lauburu: La swástika rectilínea] (Auñamendi Entziklopedia).</ref> finds no specimen of hooked crosses, round nor straight, in the Basque area until modern times. [[Paracelsus]]'s ''[[Archidoxis Magicae]]'' features a symbol<ref name="Paracelsus">[http://www.euskomedia.org/aunamendi/38522?idi=en&op=15&primR=21&regs=10&EIKVOGEN=lauburu&pos=29&img=6&voz=87432 Picture] in the [[Auñamendi Entziklopedia]].</ref> similar to the lauburu that is to be drawn to heal animals. [[M. Colas]] considers that the lauburu is not related to the swastika but comes from Paracelsus and marks the tombs of healers of animals and healers of souls (i.e. priests). Around the end of the 16th century, the lauburu appears abundantly as a Basque decorative element, in wooden chests or tombs, perhaps as another form of the cross.<ref name="Conclusiones">[http://www.euskomedia.org/aunamendi/87432?idi=en&clave=87432&op=4&primR=21&regs=10&EIKVOGEN=lauburu&pos=29&epi=64716#mrc3 Lauburu: Conclusiones] in Auñamendi Entziklopedia.</ref> Straight swastikas are not found until the 19th century. Many Basque homes and shops display the symbol over the doorway as a sort of [[amulet|talisman]]. [[Sabino Arana]] interpreted it as a [[solar symbol]], supporting his theory of a Basque [[Sun worship|solar cult]] based on wrong etymologies, in the first number of ''[[Euzkadi]]''. The lauburu has been featured on flags and emblems of various Basque political organisations including [[Eusko Abertzale Ekintza]] (EAE-ANV).
The use of the lauburu as a cultural icon fell into some disuse under the [[Francoist Spain|Francoist dictatorship]], which repressed many elements of Basque culture.
==Etymology== ''Lau buru'' means "four heads", "four ends" or "four summits" in Basque. Some{{who?|date=April 2014}} argue this might be a [[folk etymology]] applied to the Latin ''[[labarum]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.euskaltzaindia.net/index.php?option=com_oeh&view=frontpage&Itemid=413&lang=eu |title=Orotariko Euskal Hiztegia |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= |work= |publisher=Euskaltzaindia |accessdate=12 January 2013}}</ref>
However, Father [[Fidel Fita]] thought the relation reversed, ''labarum'' being adapted from Basque, under [[Augustus Caesar]]'s rule.<ref name="Fita">Letter from Fita to Fernández Guerra, reproduced in his ''Cantabria'', note 8, page 126, reproduced in ''Historia crítica de Vizcaya y de sus Fueros'', by [[Gregorio Balparda]], according to [http://www.euskomedia.org/aunamendi/87432?idi=en&clave=87432&op=4&primR=21&regs=10&EIKVOGEN=lauburu&pos=29&epi=64714#mrc1 Auñamendi Entziklopedia]</ref>

revision.text:
[[Citizen science]] projects are activities sponsored by a wide variety of organizations so non-scientists can meaningfully contribute to scientific research. Activities vary widely from transcribing old ship logbooks to digitize the data as part of the [[Old Weather]] project to observing and counting birds at home or in the field for [[eBird]].<ref name=seattle>{{cite news|last=Mapes|first=Lynda V.|title=Citizen scientists can be climate sleuths too|url=http://seattletimes.com/html/localnews/2020373355_citizensciencexml.html|accessdate=18 February 2013|newspaper=Seattle Times|date=February 16, 2013}}</ref><ref name=NYT>{{cite news|last=Robbins|first=Jim|title=Crowdsourcing, for the birds|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/08/20/science/earth/crowdsourcing-for-the-birds.html?_r=0|accessdate=20 May 2014|newspaper=New York Times|date=August 19, 2013}}</ref> Participation can be as simple as playing a computer game for a project called [[Eyewire]] that may help scientists learn more about [[retina]]l [[neuron]]s.<ref name=eye>{{cite web|title=Update: EyeWire|url=http://www.scientificamerican.com/citizen-science/project.cfm?id=update-eyewire-mit|publisher=Scientific American|accessdate=18 February 2013}}</ref> It can also be more in depth, such as when citizens collect water quality data over time to assess the health of local waters, or help discover and name new species of insect.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Schilthuizen|first=Menno|last2=Seip|first2=Lilian|last3=Otani|first3=Sean|last4=Suhaimi|first4=Jadda|last5=Njunjić|first5=Iva|date=2017-06-12|title=Three new minute leaf litter beetles discovered by citizen scientists in Maliau Basin, Malaysian Borneo (Coleoptera: Leiodidae, Chrysomelidae)|url=https://doi.org/10.3897/BDJ.5.e21947|journal=Biodiversity Data Journal|language=en|volume=5|doi=10.3897/bdj.5.e21947|issn=1314-2828}}</ref><ref>http://acwi.gov/monitoring/vm/index.html</ref> An emerging branch of Citizen Science are Community Mapping projects that utilize smartphone and tablet technology. For example, TurtleSAT<ref>http://turtlesat.org.au</ref> is a community mapping project that is mapping freshwater turtle deaths throughout Australia.
Lists of citizen science projects may change. For example, the Old Weather project website indicates that {{As of|2015|01|10|alt=as of}} January 10, 2015, 51% of the logs were completed.<ref>{{cite web|title=old Weather|url=http://www.oldweather.org/|publisher=Zooniverse|accessdate=10 January 2015}}</ref> When that project reaches 100 percent, it will move to the completed list.
There are more than 1,100 active and searchable global citizen science projects listed on the [[SciStarter]] website.<ref>[http://www.scistarter.com SciStarter]</ref>

<!-- Do not list an enterprise here unless Wikipedia already has an article dedicated to the enterprise -- it will be deleted immediately. In other words, go write a good article about it first, then come and add them here. --> Below is a list of projects that rely on [[crowdsourcing]]. See also [[open innovation]].
{{compact ToC|side=yes|top=yes|num=yes}}
== A == *[[Adaptive Vehicle Make]] is a project overseen by [[DARPA]] to crowdsource the design and manufacture of a new [[armoured vehicle]]. *AED4 allows members of the public to register locations of [[automated external defibrillator]]s (AEDs) online, to enable a nearby AED to be quickly located during an emergency using the AED4.US [[iPhone]] [[Mobile apps|app]] ([[Radboud University Nijmegen]]).<ref>[http://aed4.us/?page=overAED Dutch language summary of the aed4.eu project] ([https://www.webcitation.org/65WcgV1EC?url=http://aed4.us/?page%3DoverAED WebCite archive]). [http://www.aed4.us/ Link to U.S. website aed4.us]. Project is discussed in a [[TED (conference)|TEDtalksDirector]] [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dWZP8cUEB7Y video] that was posted 2012-02-15.</ref> *[[Air Quality Egg]]s by WickedDevices are open-source hardware Internet of Things pollution monitors that facilitate citizen crowdsourcing of air quality readings *[https://Ajapaik.ee Ajapaik.ee] is a platform for crowdsourcing geotags and [[Rephotography|rephotographs]] for historic view images (mostly photographs, but also paintings, graphic art). Most of the content is from Estonian public collections. By May 2017 almost 58 000 images have been geotagged on the platform. Since November 2016 there is also a Norwegian instance of Ajapaik platform: [https://Fotodugnad.ra.no Fotodugnad]. *[[Amara (subtitling)|Amara]] is a website that enables crowdsourced translations of videos from a variety of popular video hosting websites. The subtitles created are used to make online video content accessible to a wider audience, including the deaf and hard of hearing, and those who cannot understand the language of the source. * In 2005, [[Amazon.com]] launched the [[Amazon Mechanical Turk]], a platform on which crowdsourcing tasks called "HITs" (Human Intelligence Tasks") can be created and publicized and people can execute the tasks and be paid for doing so. Dubbed "Artificial Artificial Intelligence", it was named after [[The Turk]], an 18th-century [[chess]]-playing "machine". * americanairmuseum.com<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.americanairmuseum.com/ |title=American Air Museum in Britain|work=americanairmuseum.com}}</ref> crowdsources information about the men and women of the US Army Air Forces who served from the UK in the Second World War and the British civilians they met. It collects photographs and information. It was launched in October 2014 by [[Imperial War Museum|IWM]] as part of a project focused on the [[American Air Museum in Britain|American Air Museum]] at [[IWM Duxford]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.americanairmuseum.com/our-partners|title=Our Partners|work=americanairmuseum.com}}</ref> *The first crowdsourced documentary film is the non-profit "[[The American Revolution]]," which went into production in 2005, and which examines the role media played in the cultural, social and political changes from 1968 to 1974 through the story of underground, free-form radio station WBCN-FM in Boston.<ref>"Web Power to the People," The Boston Herald, September 29, 2005</ref><ref>"The Glory Days of the Rock of Boston," Boston Globe, Op-Ed, July 18, 2009.</ref><ref>"'BCN Documentary Looks for Archival Contributors," Boston Herald, August 11, 2009</ref><ref>"WBCN and The American Revolution," The Huffington Post, August 11, 2009</ref> When the project began, by seeking archival contributions from the public, the term "crowdsource" was not in use, and so the film was referred to as the "first open source documentary film." The film is being produced by Lichtenstein Creative Media and the non-profit Filmmakers Collaborative. * [[Arcbazar]], American crowdsourcing platform for architectural design services, established in 2010 and is headquartered in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts]] *Arkitekturbilleder.dk is a picture database documenting modern Danish architecture. Pictures are contributed by volunteer photographers with architectural education and background. *[[Article One Partners]], founded in 2008, is a community of technology experts who execute crowdsourced [[prior art search]] by researching and contributing information related to [[patents]]. By submitting research to the online platform, the community members compete for cash rewards, ranging from $5,000 to $50,000.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2008/nov/24/internet-firm-reward-researchers-patents-evidence/ | work=The Washington Times | title=Internet Firm to Reward Researchers for Patent Evidence | date=2008-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.businessinsider.com/patent-research-startup-article-one-partners-raises-5-million-2010-7 | work=Business Insider | title=Startup 2009 Winner Article One Partners Raises $5 Million | first=Nick | last=Saint | date=2010-07-27}}</ref> *AstroDrone<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.astrodrone.org/|title=Page Redirection|work=astrodrone.org}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> is a scientific crowdsourcing project of the [[European Space Agency]]. It involves a game for the [[Parrot AR.Drone]]. While players perform space missions in an augmented reality, visual features are extracted from the robot's camera images. If players agree to contribute to the experiment, these features are sent to a database. Analysis of the database is meant to improve robotic perception for tasks such as obstacle avoidance. *Australian Historic Newspapers<ref>{{cite web|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ |title=trove.nla.gov.au |publisher=trove.nla.gov.au |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> provided by the National Library of Australia encourages members of the public to correct/fix up/improve the electronically translated (OCR) text of old newspapers. This means the full-text search capability is instantly improved for everyone. The service was released in August 2008 and by March 2010 over 12 million lines of text had been improved by thousands of public users. This is the first library project in the world that has undertaken crowdsourcing on a large scale. The leader of the project Rose Holley is an advocate of using crowdsourcing to help libraries and archives expose and improve digital resources and has written articles about the Australian newspaper achievements<ref>[http://trove.nla.gov.au/work/22531631 "Many Hands Make Light Work: Public Collaborative OCR Text Correction in Australian Historic Newspapers"] Report published by the National Library of Australia. March 2009. Retrieved 26-04-2010</ref> and tips for libraries on how to crowdsource effectively.<ref>[http://www.dlib.org/dlib/march10/holley/03holley.html "Crowdsourcing – How and Why Should Libraries Do It?"] Article in D-Lib Magazine. March 2010. Retrieved 26-04-2010</ref>
== B == * [[Berkeley Open System for Skill Aggregation]] (BOSSA), by analogy with the [[distributed computing]] project [[Berkeley Open Infrastructure for Network Computing]] (BOINC) * [[Betaville]] is an interactive multi-person architectural software and [[open source]] platform, which enables the public to visualise planned buildings that are to be built and collaborate or give feedback on [[urban planning]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Betaville (official site)|url=http://bxmc.poly.edu/betaville|publisher=Brooklyn eXperimental Media Center|accessdate=2 October 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120924072544/http://bxmc.poly.edu/betaville|archivedate=24 September 2012|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Betaville lets New Yorkers play real-world Sim City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-19753721|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=2 October 2012|date=2012-10-02}}</ref> * Any software project with an [[Closed beta test|open Beta test]]. * [[BlueServo]] was a free website which crowdsources surveillance of the Texas-Mexico border through live camera streams over the Internet. This evolved from an initiative taken by the [[Government of Texas|State of Texas]], which announced it would install 200 mobile cameras along the [[Mexico–United States border|Texas-Mexico border]], to enable anyone with an Internet connection to watch the border and report sightings of alleged [[illegal immigrants]] to [[United States Border Patrol|border patrol agents]]. It was later shut down due to lack of funding.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.khou.com/news/state/stories/khou071119_rm_bordercameras.1b1f3f6b.html |title=Texas Governor finds $3 million for border cameras |work= |author= |year=2007 |accessdate=2007-11-27 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071121205609/http://www.khou.com/news/state/stories/khou071119_rm_bordercameras.1b1f3f6b.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate=2007-11-21}}</ref> *''[[Britain in a Day]]'' is a [[Ridley Scott]] film, a successor project to ''[[Life in a Day (2011 film)|Life in a Day]]'' and part of the BBC's Cultural Olympiad, in which people in Britain filmed themselves on 12 November 2011, and submitted video clips online for inclusion in the film.<ref name="RadioTimes20111005">Jones, Paul, [http://www.radiotimes.com/news/2011-10-05/ridley-scott-to-help-create-a-portrait-of-britain-in-a-day "Ridley Scott to help create a portrait of Britain in a Day"] ([https://www.webcitation.org/62rVct4w9?url=http://www.radiotimes.com/news/2011-10-05/ridley-scott-to-help-create-a-portrait-of-britain-in-a-day WebCite archive]), ''[[Radio Times]],'' 5 October 2011.</ref>
== C == * [[California Digital Newspaper Collection]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cdnc.ucr.edu/ |title=cdnc.ucr.edu |publisher=cdnc.ucr.edu |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> In August 2011 the California Digital Newspaper Collection implemented crowdsourced OCR text correction of its digitized historical newspapers, some published as early as 1846 (California statehood 1850). CDNC is a project of the Center for Bibliographical Studies and Research (CBSR) at the University of California, Riverside. The CDNC is supported in part by the U.S. Institute of Museum and Library Services under the provisions of the Library Services and Technology Act, administered in California by the State Librarian. *[[Historic Cambridge Newspaper Collection]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cambridge.dlconsulting.com |title=cambridge.dlconsulting.com |publisher=cambridge.dlconsulting.com |accessdate=2013-10-24}}</ref> In March 2011, the [[Cambridge Public Library]] in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts]] launched a digital collection of historic newspapers that implements crowdsourced OCR text correction. The freely accessible and keyword searchable database contains newspapers dating back to 1846 when Cambridge was established as a city. The Historic Cambridge Newspaper Collection is a project of the [[Cambridge Room]], the Cambridge Public Library's Archives and Special Collections, and is supported by funding from the [[Community Preservation Act]]. * [[Chicago History Museum]] on October 14, 2013, announced a project asking the public to furnish ideas for a future exhibition and reducing the most-often-submitted ideas to one assignment through a series of public votes. According to the American Alliance of Museums, this is the first crowdsourcing project allowing the public to give an exhibition assignment to an American museum. * [[CitySourced]] is an enterprise civic engagement platform. CitySourced provides a mobile app in order for citizens to identify and report non-emergency civic issues, such as public works, quality of life, and environmental issues. The service is part of the e-Government or gov 2.0 movement, which aims to connect government and citizens through the use of technology. * [[Cisco]] Systems Inc. held an I-Prize contest in which teams using collaborative technologies created innovative business plans. The winners in 2008 was a three-person team, Anna Gossen from Munich, her husband Niels Gossen, and her brother, Sergey Bessonnitsyn, that created a business plan demonstrating how IP technology could be used to increase energy efficiency. More than 2,500 people from 104 countries entered the competition. The winning team won US$250,000.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.itworldcanada.com/a/Daily-News/563ea3a9-deab-4536-8b24-819f8de1c3d4.html | title = Why the Cisco i-Prize is so powerful | work = ComputerWorld Canada | author = Dave Webb | date = Oct 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://newsroom.cisco.com/dlls/2008/prod_101408b.html | title = Cisco Selects Winner of Global I-Prize Innovation Contest | date= 2008-10-14}}</ref> * Citizen Archivist Dashboard<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.archives.gov/citizen-archivist/ |title=Citizen Archivist Dashboard |publisher=Archives.gov |date=2011-10-19 |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> is a project developed by the US [[National Archives and Records Administration]], beginning with users transcribing 1940 [[Census]] data. * Civil War Diaries & Letters Transcription Project:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://digital.lib.uiowa.edu/cwd/transcripts.html |title=Transcription – The University of Iowa Libraries|work=uiowa.edu}}</ref> help improve access to handwritten documents held by The University of Iowa Libraries. * [[Clickworkers]] – experimental NASA site * Colored Conventions Project<ref>{{cite web|url=http://coloredconventions.org|title=ColoredConventions.org|work=coloredconventions.org}}</ref> at the [[University of Delaware]] has launched the Transcribe Minutes<ref>{{cite web|url=http://coloredconventions.org/transcribe-minutes|title=Transcribe Minutes|work=coloredconventions.org}}</ref> project to transcribe records of the nineteenth-century [[African American]] [[Colored Conventions Movement]]. The first batch of available documents includes well-known leaders such as [[Frederick Douglass]] and [[Henry Highland Garnet]] from the 1840s. * Condor Watch. The [[California condor]] is a critically endangered species and the population is suffering from the effects of lead poisoning. By tracking the location and social behavior of the animals we can better detect early warning signs of the illness.<ref>{{cite web| title=Condor Watch| url=http://www.condorwatch.org| date=Spring 2014| accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref> A [[Zooniverse (citizen science project)|Zooniverse]] project. *Crowd-Sourced Assessment of Technical Skills (C-SATS), Inc. is a Seattle, WA based medical performance assessment company that performs crowd-based assessment of surgical skills.<ref>{{citation |accessdate=2014-11-27 |title=C-SATS, Inc. |url=http://www.csats.com/}}</ref> * [[Crowdcrafting]] is a crowdsourcing platform that invites volunteers to contribute to scientific projects developed by citizens, professionals or institutions that need help to solve problems, analyze data or complete challenging tasks that cannot be done by machines alone, but require human intelligence. The platform is 100% open source – i.e. its software is developed and distributed freely – and 100% open-science, making scientific research accessible to everyone.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://crowdcrafting.org/| title=Crowdcrafting| publisher=SciFabric| accessdate=November 16, 2015}}</ref> * [[Crowdin]] is a localization management platform for mobile apps, web, desktop software and related assets. [[Reddit]], [[Khan Academy]], [[Minecraft]] and other used the platform to crowdsource localization.<ref> {{cite web|last=J0hj0h|title=Be a Translator! Site|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/i18n/wiki/getting_started|work=Blog|publisher=Reddit}}</ref><ref> [http://sundayresearch.eu/hitoshi/sundayresearch/khanacademy_japanese/howto_contribute_ka_internationalization_en.html Khan Academy Translations]</ref> * [[CrowdFlower]] was founded in 2007 to manage internet crowdsourcing. It is currently the largest provider of crowdsourcing solutions for enterprise with over 450 million tasks completed and 2 million contributors.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/techonomy/2011/10/26/crowdsourcing-scientific-progress-how-crowdflowers-hordes-help-harvard-researchers-study-tb/ |title=Crowdsourcing Scientific Progress: How Crowdflower's Hordes Help Harvard Researchers Study TB |publisher=Forbes.com |accessdate=2013-09-23 |first=Adrienne |last=Burke |date=2011-10-26}}</ref> * [[CrowdMed]] is a healthcare crowdsourcing platform based in San Francisco, California.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://angel.co/crowdmed| title=CrowdMed| publisher=AngelList| accessdate=February 9, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web| url=http://readwrite.com/2013/05/08/crowdmed-wants-to-crowdsource-your-medical-care| title=CrowdMed Wants To Crowdsource Your Medical Care To Strangers| author=Brian S. Hall| date=May 8, 2013| publisher=Readwrite| accessdate=February 9, 2015}}</ref> * [[Crowdspring]] is a marketplaces for crowdsourced creative services.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.crowdspring.com/|title=Logo Design, Web Design and Naming by the World's Best Creative Team – crowdSPRING|work=crowdspring.com}}</ref> * [[Crowdville]] combines crowdsourcing, gamification and industrial expertise.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.crowdville.net/| title=Crowdville| publisher=crowdville| accessdate=November 10, 2015}}</ref> * [[CrowdWater]] collects hydrological data such as runoff, water level, soil moisture and stream mapping and explores its potential for hydrological modeling.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.crowdwater.ch/| title=CrowdWater| publisher=crowdwater| accessdate=July 4, 2016}}</ref>
== D == *The 2007 [[DARPA]] [[DARPA Grand Challenge (2007)|Urban Challenge]] focused on autonomous vehicles, requiring participating teams to create an autonomous vehicle that was able to successfully navigate traffic as well as complex maneuvers including merging, passing, and parking. To successfully complete the challenge, participating vehicles needed to complete a 60-mile course in less than six hours.<ref>{{Cite news|title = Crashes and Traffic Jams in Military Test of Robotic Vehicles|url = https://www.nytimes.com/2007/11/05/technology/05robot.html|newspaper = The New York Times|date = 2007-11-05|access-date = 2015-10-21|issn = 0362-4331|first = John|last = Markoff}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Saturday's DARPA Urban Challenge finalists trimmed to 11 teams|url = http://www.gizmag.com/go/8277/|website = www.gizmag.com|accessdate = 2015-10-21}}</ref> *[[Dell IdeaStorm]] is a [[website]] launched by [[Dell]] on February 16, 2007 to allow Dell "to gauge which ideas are most important and most relevant to" the public.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ideastorm.com/idea2AboutIdeaStorm?v=1417262522468|title=Idea Storm|website=www.ideastorm.com|accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref> * The [[Democratic National Committee]] launched FlipperTV in November 2007 and McCainpedia in May 2008 to crowdsource video gathered by Democratic trackers and research compiled by DNC staff in the hands of the public to do with as they chose.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mccainpedia.org |title=McCainPedia |work=DNC |author=DNC |accessdate=2008-05-19}}</ref><ref name="Shutterstock and Crowdsourcing">{{cite news|title=Wired 6.06|url=https://www.wired.com/wired/archive/14.06/crowds.html | date = 2006-06-01|accessdate=2009-02-02|work=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]|author=Howe, Jeff}}</ref> * Desall, an open innovation and crowdsourcing design platform based in Italy, where companies from different industries crowdsource their innovation needs across several areas of design (industrial design, product design, interior design, craft design, graphic design, packaging, naming and new idea) to an international community of designers, engineers, architects, creatives and students. The platform went live on 2012. It was acknowledged as one of the "Top 25 Hottest European Early-Stage Companies" according to Informilo.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Top 25 Hottest European Early-Stage Companies|url = http://www.informilo.com/2014/11/top-25-hottest-european-early-stage-companies/ |website = Informilo|accessdate=2014-11-04}}</ref> * The Desal Prize, launched as part of the Securing Water for Food Grand Challenge for Development in conjunction with the [[United States Bureau of Reclamation]], was designed to crowdsource a small-scale, environmentally sustainable, brackish water desalination system with the capability to produce potable water for human consumption in addition to water that could be used for agriculture in developing countries.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Engineers compete to make salt water drinkable|url = https://www.cnbc.com/2015/04/09/-teams-compete-to-make-salt-water-drinkable.html|website = CNBC|accessdate = 2015-10-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = MIT Wins Prize for Process to Desalinate Seawater|url = http://www.nbcnews.com/science/environment/mit-wins-prize-process-desalinate-seawater-n347031|website = NBC News|accessdate = 2015-10-21}}</ref> * [[DesignCrowd]], a crowdsourcing marketplace for graphic design and creative services, launched in February 2008 and helped run a contest for global footwear company HI-TEC. HI-TEC "estimated that using DesignCrowd.com [and crowdsourcing] for the project saved HI-TEC up to half the costs of going down the usual design route".<ref name="DesignCrowd and Crowdsourcing">{{cite news|title=New business tool that's pulling the crowds and saving money|url=http://business.smh.com.au/business/new-business-tool-thats-pulling-the-crowds-and-saving-money-20090408-a0vl.html | date = 2009-04-09|work=[[Sydney Morning Herald]]|author=Sophocleous, Andrea}}</ref> DesignCrowd purchased [[Brandstack|BrandStack]] and formed BrandCrowd On 20 December 2011. * [[LEGO Design byME]] was a service connected with the construction toy [[Lego]]. Launched in 2005 under the name ''Lego Factory'', the service allowed people to design their own Lego models using a computer program, then upload them to the Lego website, design their own box design, and order them for actual delivery. The brand also covers a small selection of products that have been designed by Lego fans, and which were available to purchase as a set. * Dickens Journals online<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.djo.org.uk/ |title=djo.org.uk |publisher=djo.org.uk |date=2013-03-15 |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> is a collaborative effort to digitize and edit journals of [[Charles Dickens]]. * The search for aviator [[Steve Fossett]], whose plane went missing in Nevada in 2007, in which up to 50,000 people examined high-resolution satellite imagery from [[DigitalGlobe]] that was made available via [[Amazon Mechanical Turk]]. The search was ultimately unsuccessful.<ref name="wired 11 sept">Steve Friess, [https://www.wired.com/software/webservices/news/2007/09/distributed_search 50,000 Volunteers Join Distributed Search For Steve Fossett], [[Wired News]], 2007-09-11</ref><ref name="Wired Nov6">Steve Friess, [https://www.wired.com/techbiz/it/news/2007/11/fossett_search Online Fossett Searchers Ask, Was It Worth It?], Wired.com, 2007-11-06</ref> Fosset's remains were eventually located by more traditional means.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/oct/02/usa2|title=Timeline: Steve Fossett disappearance|work=the Guardian}}</ref> [[DigitalGlobe]] satellite imagery had previously been posted to [[Amazon Mechanical Turk]] after the disappearance of computer scientist [[Jim Gray (computer scientist)|Jim Gray]] at sea in January 2007, an effort that had attracted much media attention, but not provided any new clues.<ref name="nythafner">{{cite news | date = February 3, 2007 | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2007/02/03/technology/03search.html?ex=1328158800&en=e58764b50c8a4508&ei=5090&partner=rssuserland&emc=rss | title = Silicon Valley's High-Tech Hunt for Colleague | work = [[New York Times]] | first=Katie | last=Hafner | accessdate=2010-05-08}}</ref><ref>[https://www.wired.com/techbiz/people/magazine/15-08/ff_jimgray Inside the High-Tech Hunt for a Missing Silicon Valley Legend], [[Wired Magazine]] (August 2007)</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mturk.com/mturk/preview?groupId=J0XZ58STDWJZ5QY4F9M0 |title=Amazon Mechanical Turk volunteer project to help locate Jim Gray |publisher=Mturk.com |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.openphi.net/tenacious/ |title=Blog for people trying to locate Jim Gray |publisher=Openphi.net |accessdate=2013-09-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150703024036/http://www.openphi.net/tenacious/ |archivedate=2015-07-03 |df= }}</ref> * DigiVol<ref>{{cite web|url=http://volunteer.ala.org.au/ |title=DigiVol |accessdate=2015-10-02}}</ref> is a project developed by the Australian Museum, in collaboration with the Atlas of Living Australia, to harness the power of online volunteers to digitise data that is locked up in biodiversity collections, field notebooks and survey sheets. * [[Distributed Proofreaders]] (commonly abbreviated as DP or PGDP) is a Web-based project founded in 2000 by Charles Franks that supports the development of e-texts for [[Project Gutenberg]] by allowing many people to work together in proofreading drafts of e-texts for errors. As of October 2011, over 21,000 e-texts have been produced by DP. There are also offshoots (sister sites) such as DP-Europe and DP-Canada. * DIY History<ref>{{cite web|url=http://diyhistory.lib.uiowa.edu |title=diyhistory.lib.uiowa.edu |publisher=diyhistory.lib.uiowa.edu |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> is a project from the [[University of Iowa]] that calls upon the public to help transcribe historical documents. It began as a project to help transcribe American Civil War diaries and grew to include every type of historical document, most notably more than 300 years of handwritten cookbooks from the Chef [[Louis Szathmary]] Culinary Collection. *[[Message in a bottle|Drift bottle experiments]] are [[citizen science]] experiments in which a surveying organization throws into large bodies of water, bottles containing messages requesting finders of the bottles to return the messages to the organization with a statement of the time and place at which the bottles were found, allowing the organization to determine patterns of water circulation in the bodies of water.<ref name=Atlantic20120905>Madrigal, Alexis C., [https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2012/09/found-worlds-oldest-message-in-a-bottle-part-of-1914-citizen-science-experiment/261981/ "Found: World's Oldest Message in a Bottle, Part of 1914 Citizen-Science Experiment"] ([https://www.webcitation.org/6ASZ6E65M?url=http://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2012/09/found-worlds-oldest-message-in-a-bottle-part-of-1914-citizen-science-experiment/261981/ WebCite archive]), ''[[The Atlantic]],'' September 5, 2012.</ref> *[[Duolingo]]: With Duolingo you learn a language for free while helping to translate the web via their "Immersion" feature. The Immersion feature was retired in early 2017.
== E == *[http://emmo.folger.edu/ EMMO] or Early Modern Manuscripts Online provides transcriptions, metadata and images of manuscripts from the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries, hosted by the [[Folger Shakespeare Library]]. *[[Emporis]], a provider of building data, has run the Emporis Community (a website where members can submit building information) since May 2000. Today, more than 1,000 members contribute building data throughout the world. *The [[ESP Game]] by [[Luis von Ahn]] (later acquired by [[Google]] and renamed [[Google Image Labeler]]) started in 2003 and gets people to label images as a side-effect of playing a game. The image labels can be used to improve image search on the Web. This game led to the concept of [[Game with a purpose|Games with a purpose]]. *[[EteRNA]], a game in which players attempt to design [[RNA]] sequences that fold into a given configuration. The widely varied solutions from players, often non-biologists, are evaluated to improve computer models predicting RNA folding. Some designs are actually [[RNA synthesis|synthesized]] to evaluate the actual folding dynamics and directly compare with the computer models. *Europeana 1914–1918<ref>{{cite web|last=Arnott |first=Rebecca |url=http://www.europeana1914-1918.eu/ |title=uropeana1914-1918.eu |publisher=Europeana1914-1918.eu |date=2013-09-07 |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> is a collaboration led by [[Europeana]] with support from The Great War Archive<ref name="Oucs.ox.ac.uk">{{cite web|url=http://www.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ww1lit/gwa |title=The Great War Archive | First World War Poetry Digital Archive |publisher=Oucs.ox.ac.uk |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> team at the [[University of Oxford]]. A website<ref name="europeana1918">{{cite web|last=Arnott |first=Rebecca |url=http://www.europeana1914-1918.eu/ |title=europeana1914-1918.eu |publisher=europeana1914-1918.eu |date=2013-09-07 |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> is used by the project to encourage the public from all [[European Union]] states to contribute information about [[World War I]], especially their family's stories and digitised photographs of their artefacts. In addition to the website,<ref name="europeana1918"/> since 2011 [[First World War]] stories have been collected in person from family history roadshow events held in [[Germany]], [[Luxembourg]], [[Ireland]], [[Slovenia]], [[Denmark]], with further events planned in [[Cyprus]], [[Belgium]], [[Italy]] and more.<ref name="pro.europeana.eu">{{cite web |url=http://pro.europeana.eu/web/europeana-1914-1918 |title=Europeana Professional: Europeana 1914-1918 website |publisher=Pro.europeana.eu |accessdate=2013-09-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130916062057/http://pro.europeana.eu/web/europeana-1914-1918 |archivedate=2013-09-16 |df= }}</ref> The items collected by the project are released on the Internet for use under a [[Creative Commons]] licence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.europeana1914-1918.eu/en/about/terms |title=Europeana 1914-1918 terms and conditions |publisher=Europeana1914-1918.eu |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> *[[EyesOnALZ]] project enables everyone to contribute to Alzheimer’s disease research and speed up drug discovery by playing online game [[Stall Catchers]]. Players look at microscope movies of live mouse brain and search for stalled vessels. *[[EyeWire]], a game by [[Sebastian Seung]] in which players help an algorithm to segment retinal cells in 3D images of the retina. The aim is to map a mouse retina by extracting individual neurons and their connections to each other.
== F == * [[Facebook]] has used crowdsourcing since 2008 to create different language versions of its site. The company claims this method offers the advantage of providing site versions that are more compatible with local cultures.<ref>[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/24205912 "Facebook asks users to translate for free"] MSNBC.com 18 April 2008. Retrieved 4 March 2010</ref> * [[FamilySearch Indexing]] is a volunteer project which aims to create searchable digital indexes for scanned images of historical documents. The documents are drawn primarily from a collection of 2.4 million microfilms made of historical documents from 110 countries and principalities. Volunteers install free software on their home computers, download images from the site, type the data they read from the image into the software, and submit their work back to the site. The data is eventually made publicly and freely available at familysearch.org<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.familysearch.org |title=familysearch.org |publisher=familysearch.org |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> (the world's largest nonprofit genealogical organization) for use in [[genealogy|genealogical]] research. Over one billion historical records have been transcribed to date.<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=https://familysearch.org/blog/en/billion/ |title="Thanks a Billion", FamilySearch Blog |publisher=Familysearch.org |date=2013-04-22 |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> *There is an ongoing effort by United States [[Federal Communications Commission]] (FCC) to use crowdsourcing to collect ideas on how to best build out America's broadband infrastructure. The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 calls for increased broadband deployment. The site, broadband.ideascale.com,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://broadband.ideascale.com |title=broadband.ideascale.com |publisher=broadband.ideascale.com |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> allows a citizen to post an idea related to this initiative. Other visitors are invited to vote the ideas up or down. The ideas and comments have been made part of the public record.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://hraunfoss.fcc.gov/edocs_public/attachmatch/DA-10-42A1.pdf/ | title = Fcc explains relationship of ideascale postings to the record in the national broadband plan proceeding | work = | author = | year = 2010 | accessdate = 2010-01-11}}</ref> * Feedback Roulette<ref name="feedbackroulette1">{{cite web|url=http://feedbackroulette.com/ |title=feedbackroulette.com |publisher=feedbackroulette.com |accessdate=2013-09-23}}</ref> is a free service for anonymous exchange of feedback about websites. There are over 4500 registered members, over 4700 websites and over 19000 reviews submitted according to the publicly available statistics. Members review each other's websites and rate received reviews to specify how useful the feedback is. Based on that the reviewer's reputation is calculated. The system then uses the reputation to match reviewers. Feedback Roulette<ref name="feedbackroulette1"/> audience includes web masters, designers, developers, Internet business owners and entrepreneurs and anyone who is interested in gathering feedback and improving their website. * [[Folding@Home]] is a [[distributed computing]] project for disease research that simulates [[protein folding]], computational [[drug design]], and other types of [[molecular dynamics]]. The project uses the [[idle processing resources]] of thousands of [[personal computers]] owned by volunteers who have installed the software on their systems. Its primary purpose is to determine the mechanisms of protein folding. This is of academic interest with implications for medical research into [[Alzheimer's disease]], [[Huntington's disease]], and many forms of [[cancer]], among other diseases.<ref name="NVIDIA20141124">Austin, Liz, [http://blogs.nvidia.com/blog/2014/11/24/nvidia-foundation-awards-400000-to-two-teams-pioneering-cancer-research/ ''NVIDIA foundation awards $400,000 to two teams pioneering cancer research''] (NVIDIA blogs, Retrieved 8 January 2015)</ref> * [[Foldit]] invites the general public to play protein folding games to discover folding strategies. Citing [[Foldit]], MSNBC's Alan Boyle reported that "video-game players have solved a molecular puzzle that stumped scientists for years," indicating that they "figure(d) out the detailed molecular structure of a protein-cutting enzyme from an AIDS-like virus found in rhesus monkeys."<ref name="MSNBC20110918">Boyle, Alan, [http://cosmiclog.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2011/09/16/7802623-gamers-solve-molecular-puzzle-that-baffled-scientists "Gamers solve molecular puzzle that baffled scientists"] ([https://www.webcitation.org/61o8AJ4GJ?url=http://cosmiclog.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2011/09/16/7802623-gamers-solve-molecular-puzzle-that-baffled-scientists WebCite archive]), MSNBC.com, September 18, 2011.</ref> * [[Freelancer.com]] started out in Sweden in 2004 as GetAFreelancer.com, and is now owned by Sydney, Australia-based Ignition Networks. M Barrie, the CEO, claims the company is the largest outsourcing site in the world, receiving more global traffic than competitor elance. The site has 1.5 million users in 234 countries and the average job size is under $200 and it projects a US$50 million in project turnover in the next 12 months. The site takes a 10 percent cut on work allocated.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.smartcompany.com.au/internet/20100608-the-10-stars-of-australia-s-crowd-sourcing-hub/2.html | title = The stars of Australia's crowd-sourcing hub | work = | author = Brad Howarth | date = 8 June 2010 | accessdate = 2010-06-15 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20100611054407/http://www.smartcompany.com.au/internet/20100608-the-10-stars-of-australia-s-crowd-sourcing-hub/2.html# | archive-date = 2010-06-11 | dead-url = yes | df = }}</ref> * [[FromThePage]] is free software that allows volunteers to transcribe handwritten documents online.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fromthepage.com|title=FromThePage|work=fromthepage.com}}</ref> It is used by the [[San Diego Natural History Museum]] to transcribe the [[Laurence Monroe Klauber|Laurence M. Klauber]] Field Notes, by [[Southwestern University]] to transcribe the Mexican War diary of Zenas Matthews,<ref>{{cite web | title = Collaborative Transcription Project | url=http://www.southwestern.edu/live/news/6475-collaborative-transcription-project | date = 2012-02-09 | accessdate = 2012-06-27}}</ref> and others. The platform integrates with the [[Archive.org]] [[Content Management System|CMS]], and the transcriptions can include semantic mark-up for indexing and annotation. Users can either host the platform on their own servers by getting the source code from GitHub,<ref>[https://github.com/benwbrum/fromthepage/wiki Source code] on GitHub, accessed 27 June 2012</ref> or have hosting provided by the FromThePage organization.
== G ==
*[[Galaxy Zoo]] is a [[citizen science]] project that lets members of the public classify a million galaxies from the [[Sloan Digital Sky Survey]]. The project has led to numerous scientific papers and [[citizen scientist]]-led discoveries such as [[Hanny's Voorwerp]]. * "The Gateway to Astronaut Photography of Earth – Image Detective" is an interactive citizen science hunt for the Earth location of images taken from space by astronauts since the 1960s.
